text: hi everyone today I will show you how to
make my version of Vietnamese kimchi and
also share with you the traditional
Korean kimchi recipe that I've learned
in the kimchi making class in Seoul last
year so let's begin
recipes for Vietnamese kimchi you can
use any kind of cabbage for example napa
cabbage or potted cabbage or just normal
one about a inch or 20 centimeter
cucumber and a small carrot to prepare
the cabbage detach the leaves I'm just
going to use about 6 to 8 leaves for the
recipe today cut into 1-inch pieces puke
akimbo in random strips like this so we
can keep some green color in the
vegetable mixed cut the cooking board in
half lengthwise and remove the soft part
inside then slice into half inch pieces
also peel carrot and slide into thin
slices you can also prune the carrot and
slice it into flowers like this just
make shallow v-shaped incisions around
the carrot and then slide horizontally
then mix all the vegetables together and
add about 1 to 2 TSP of salt give it a
good toss and set aside for a few hours
or overnight the salt will pull the
water out of the vegetables and make it
wilted but crispy then brings a few
times to remove the salt after that we
have the water in the vegetables and
place it in a large mixing bowl you can
also add green onion garlic drives or
other kinds of vegetables as well to
make the sauce for the kimchi you will
need 2 cloves of garlic a thumb sized
piece of ginger and as many chillies as
you can take
peel the garlic and ginger and place
everything in the mortar add a
tablespoon of sugar to prevent the items
from flying out during the pairing
process then you a pestle to power
finally into a paste lettuce for this
sauce I'm going to use equal amounts of
sugar fish sauce and vinegar so in total
two tablespoon of sugar two tablespoons
of fish sauce and two tablespoons of
vinegar so it has the balance of sweet
sour salty and spiciness then give it a
good stir to have the sugar dissolve
finally just mix the vegetables with the
sauce or you can call it dressing and
it's done you can have a taste and
adjust the seasonings to your personal
preference it will taste better after a
few hours because the vegetable will
have some time to absorb the dressings
you can store it in a container and put
in the fridge for a few weeks it is
perfect as a side dish for any meat
dishes that was a very quick and easy
recipe but if you're up for a challenge
now comes the traditional Korean kimchi
recipe as some of you might have already
know I was in Korea last year and
attended the kimchi making class at the
co traditional cultural center is the
place where tourists can experience
traditional home culture some of you
requested to know the recipe I learned
in the class so here you go you want to
cut the cabbage and wise into quarters
then you cause your salt to massage into
the cabbage until it starts to soften a
bit then add water to cover the cabbage
and leave it overnight until wilted to
prepare the kimchi paste you're gonna
need three tbsp of Korean hot pepper
flakes 1/3 TSP sugar a tablespoon of
minced garlic
about half a teaspoon of minced ginger
two tablespoon of sweet rice water which
is the water you get when you saw
glutinous rice in water overnight you
also need a tablespoon of plum juice a
tablespoon of this sauce and a
tablespoon of curry insulted fermented
small shrimps you should be able to get
these ingredients at your local Korean
store and finally you also need some
salt to season to your taste
cut radish in julienne strips this is
Korean radish which is shorter and
router in shape but you can definitely
use the normal type also peel and cut a
quarter of an airport into julienne
strips cut one to two stalks of green
onion into two inch lengths and this is
new to me
water celery stem also cut into the same
length at the green onion
place all the chopped vegetables into
the large mixing bowl then gradually add
in the seasonings hot pepper paste and
sugar we'll go in first
then you want to massage the Julian to
vegetables and mix really well I was
told this is to make the red color
becomes more vibrant I just kept mixing
while waiting for the ladies to go
around and distribute more ingredients
next I have a tablespoon of the Korean
fermented so this room's a tablespoon of
minced garlic 1/2 a teaspoon of ginger
finally I get the sweet rice water plum
sauce and fish sauce continue massaging
the vegetables until is become color
mushy
now have a taste and decide whether you
want to add a little more salt then you
want to wrap the kimchi paste or over
the outsides of the cabbage first and
then open each leaf and rock the pace in
between the leaves you just want to wrap
a thin layer of the paste and not too
much just repeat the process until the
paste fully covers every leaf
when finished pack the cabbage in the
container and let it ferment for a few
days at room temperature my cabbage was
a little oversized compared to the
container so I needed some help from the
tutor to rewrap it nicely and put it
back into the container after a few days
when it gets hour enough to your liking
you can refrigerate and keep for many
weeks or month
kimchi can be served as a side dish to
any Korean dishes so you just serve it
as you like that's it I hope you like
this video don't forget to click like
and subscribe thank you for watching bye
